poem:
An Evening with Boris

The price of touch,  
a hundred and twenty-one—  
to bask in presence,  
to clasp ambition's hand  
and seal it with  
a fleeting flash—  
the cost of memory,  
posed and polished  
in Edinburgh's hall,  
where questions linger,  
valued like this  
briefest commodity.  
A smile, a shake—  
currency exchanged  
for the momentary glow.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Boris Johnson fans offered £121 handshake and photo op Boris Johnson is charging £121 for a handshake and a photograph before a live event in Edinburgh. The former Conservative prime minister will appear at the Usher Hall on 2 September for an event titled An Evening with Boris Johnson, which will also allow guests to take part in a question and answer session. Audience members are charged separately for a meet-and-greet ticket in addition to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
